Yet standing on the threshold of the great
room is half in shadow half in light. He is not a
fully realised: it He is still anonymous, He in that he
does not embody confine emotions to the give

is still anonymous, in that he cannot confine
emotions within one place. He must symbolise;
exteriorise: jealousy is not a passion to be spoken;
He cannot convey jealousy by the speaking voice He must
make jealousy an actual words from an actual
mouth. He must make jealousy abstract, a symbol.
He ignores cannot cannot speak through (thro') the mouth of the
individual. The single is still in shadow. Yet, the other half of him is in the

So poets say, my Lord

At last the mummers & the [madrigals?] were given a

to listen to the same play. Before Spenser died the
playhouse was built, in which the mummers & the
[madrigals?] gave a lodging to the wandering actors;
their lodging, their centre.

No name was attached to anonymous.

The play was anonymous. That fact by itself
is enough to show how largely the play was still
the work of inspired a common product.
detached from the author, unclaimed, as they made
a common product, shaped written by one hand, but
so moulded in its transition from the written word
to the spoken that the author had no sense of
propriety in it. Thus, when we If we
And yet Our The silence of the audience

It was half the work of the audience. The audience was a

Yet the audience is silent.

The silence of the Elizabethan (E) audience is one of the deep
gulfs that lies between us & the Elizabethan (E) play.
The audience makes no comment; it is neither praises nor
damns. So
